p: District Court of the United States of America for the Second District of Washington Territory.

At the Regular Term of the District Court of the United States, begun and held at Olympia in and for the second Judicial District aforesaid, on the second day of September AD 1861 it being the first Monday of said month the Grand Jurors, good and lawful men, duly elected empanneled, sworn and charged to inquire within and for the body of said District, on their oaths present That James Riley and Thomas Horn late of the District aforesaid, on the eighteenth day of August AD 1861 at the District aforesaid, in and upon one Scomiac alias Scomeum alias Sternback alias John (an Indian) in the peace of the Territory then and there being feloniously wilfully and malice aforethought did make an assault and that they the said James Riley and Thomas Horn with a certain knife whish the said James Riley then and there had and held in and upon the beast of him the said Scamiac alias Seomeaw, Alias Stemback alias John
(an Indian) then and there feloniously willfully and of their malise of arethought did stab cut and mortally wound him the said Scomeac alias Scomeaw alias alias John (an Indian) of which mortal wound be the said Scomiac alias Scomeaw alias Stemback alias John (an Indian) did linger and lingering then and there did die and so the Jurors aforesaid upon their oaths aforesaid do say that the said James Riley and Thomas Horn him the said Scomeac alias Ssomeaw alias Stembask alias John (an Indian) in the manner and by the means aforesaid purposely deliberately and with malise aforethought did kill and murder contrary to the farm of the statute in sush case made and provided and against the fense and dignity of the Territory of Washington.

And the Jurors aforesaid upon their oaths aforesaid do further present that siad James Riley and Thomas Horn at the District aforesaid and on the day and your aforesaid in and upon an Ssomeas alias Ssomean alias Stembask alias John (an Indian) in the fense of the Territory then and there being, feloniously, wilfully and of their malise aforethought
at the District aforesaid and on the day and year aforesaid in and upon one Ssomeuc alias Ssomeaw alias Steinback alias John (an Indian) in the pease of the Territory then and there being, feloniously willfully and of their malise afarethought, and that they the said James Riley and Thomas Horn with a certain knife whish the said James Riley then and there had and held in and upon the belly of him the said Sscomeas alias Ssomeaw, alias Steinbask alias John (an Indian) then and there feloniously willfully and of their malise aforethought did stab cut and mortally wound him the said Snomeuc alias Ssomeaw alias Stembask alias John (an Indian) of whish mortal wound be the said Ssomeac alias Ssomeaw alias Steinbask alias John (an Indian) did linger and lingering then died there did die.
